intro: Hippolytia syncalathiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. It is a short-lived perennial, often blooming in late spring and early summer.
